com.malikk.shield.flags

Class Flag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.malikk.shield.flags.Flag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Flag
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A flag object allows for sets of players to be assigned boolean values in certain regions.
    Author:
    Malikk
    See Also:
    #getName()}, #getRegion()}, #getPlayers()}, #getValue()}, #setPlayers(players)}, #setValue(boolean)}, #addPlayer(player)}, #addPlayers(players)}, #removePlayer(player)}, #removePlayers(players)}, #remove()}, Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the flag.
      ShieldRegion getRegion()
      Gets the ShieldRegion the flag is set at.
      ShieldGroup getShieldGroup()
      Gets the ShieldGroup object containing the set of players assigned to this flag.

      Gets the value that the flag will return for players in its HashSet.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the flag.
        Returns:
        String - name

      • getRegion

        public ShieldRegion getRegion()
        Gets the ShieldRegion the flag is set at.
        Returns:
        ShieldRegion that the flag is set on

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Gets the value that the flag will return for players in its HashSet. For players not in the HashSet, the opposite of this value will be returned.
        Returns:
        value - Boolean assigned to the flag

      • setValue

        public void setValue(boolean value)
        Sets the value of the flag.
        Parameters:
        value - - Boolean

      • getShieldGroup

        public ShieldGroup getShieldGroup()
        Gets the ShieldGroup object containing the set of players assigned to this flag.
        Returns:
        ShieldGroup

      • setShieldGroup

        public void setShieldGroup(ShieldGroup group)
        Sets the ShieldGroup for this flag. Setting this will completely override the old object.
        Parameters:
        group - - new ShieldGroup for this flag

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes this flag completely
